item.title: Sharh-i namaz.
notes: Paper: light grey inlaid paper on dyed paper in orange and greyish green; text interlined with gold leaf; elaborate unwans for Qurʼān verses and gold ink for other section headings; text within and elaborate ruled border of gold and red; text in black and gold ink with marginal section headings also in gold; no rubrication; no catchwords.
Naskh; 9 lines in written area 15.7 x 8.7 cm.
Library of Congress. Arabic manuscript, M63.

Dark red leather contemporary binding; embossed with gold border; and center medallions. gold embossing at four corners of cartouche with center medallion; rebacked nore recently with brown leather spine.
Also available in digital form on the Library of Congress website.
summary: This work is not a commentary on the namāz, but a selection of Qurʼānic sūrahs and prayers to be read during Ramaḍān.
medium: 48 leaves (9 lines), paper : bound ; 23 x 15 cm
contents: Sūrat Yāsīn -- Sūrat al-Mulk -- Sūrat al-Ikhlāṣ -- Sūrat al-Fatḥ -- [various prayers for Ramaḍān]

subject: iran
washington (d.c.)
manuscripts, arabic
ramadan
prayers and devotions
title: Sharh-i namaz.
description: This work is not a commentary on the namāz, but a selection of Qurʼānic sūrahs and prayers to be read during Ramaḍān.
